column4: is there a way to enable the debian menu in gnome (in ubuntu)?
what is debian menu ?
it's the menu which includes many of the programs that are not in the default ubuntu applications menu
get those programs ?

er.. what i mean is, there are quite many programs that don't appear in the applications menu when they are installed. however, they usually are in the debian menu, but debian menu is disabled in ubuntu for some reason
ubuntu is based on debian
debian menu looks something like that http://www.hoamskool.net/david/misc/kde_menu.jpg
i mean the debian part of it
except that it seems to be somehow broken in that pic ;)
in smeg make a new menu .... called it debian
i guess you didn't really understand this thing..
yah ...
i don't know how to explain ... but debian menu only comes with debian ...
i can see it with smeg, but it can't be enabled
try this ... on the left debian menu .. click it .. and add new entry ...
hmm.. if the menu really is totally stripped off of ubuntu, i can only wonder why..
yes, k3b is the best there is
oh. i guess blender might be better
blender is good .. it comes with game engine as well ... but the ui is very messy
true, but i'm afraid that there's no better alternative. wings3d is good for just modelling though
k3d is just like maya .... very very clean ... i recommend you check it out ... i am impressed :P
ok :)
